text: Temple College Vocational Nursing Program VNSG 1409: Nursing in Health and Illness II Module IV: Musculoskeletal Assessment and Disorders Upon completion of this module the student will be able to: Musculoskeletal Assessment and Function: Williams/Hopper Chapter 45 1. Describe the pathophysiology, diagnostic test, and therapeutic measures pertaining to the musculoskeletal system. 2. Know how to perform an assessment of the musculoskeletal system, collecting subjective and objective data. Nursing Care of Clients with Musculoskeletal and Connective Tissue Disorders: Williams/ Hopper Chapter 46 1. Discuss the pathophysiology , etiology, signs and symptoms, treatment of musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorders 2. Describe the nursing care related to disorders of the musculoskeletal system Promoting Musculoskeletal Function: DeWit Chapter 39 1. Discuss the effects of inactivity on respiratory exchange and airway clearance. 2. Describe appropriate care of a cast as it dries. 3. Name at least four pressure relief devices that help prevent skin injury in immobile clients. 4. Correctly care for the client undergoing skin traction
